legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: Health Insight Survey

blocks.page_title: Introduction Section - Participant Confirmation

title.text: Are you completing the questions on behalf of {first_name}?

description.text: Please note, throughout this questionnaire "you" refers to {first_name}.

blocks.page_title: Introduction Section - Completing for someone else

question.title: There has been a problem accessing the survey

description.text:
This questionnaire is intended for {first_name}. You have indicated that you are not {first_name} or completing the questionnaire on behalf of them.

If this is correct, please:

1.Tick the continue box and then select “Save and continue”.

2.On the next page, select the “Submit” button to submit the questionnaire.

3.Call the helpline on 0808 196 1270. You will need your Participant ID. You can find your participant ID in your window notification email. The survey team member on the phone will tell you what to do next.

If you are {first_name}, or completing the questions on behalf of them:

1.Select “< Previous” two times. You can find this at the top left-hand side of this page, underneath the blue banner that says “Health Insight Survey”.

2.You will then need to amend the answers to be able to complete the survey.

blocks.page_title: Introduction Section - Access error message
About you - Introduction

contents.description: This section is about you, including your work or education status and your health.

description.text: Note, throughout this questionnaire "you" refers to {first_name}.

question.title: Have your personal circumstances changed since you last completed this questionnaire?

options.label: Yes, my work or education status has changed
options.value: Yes, my work or education status has changed

options.label: No
options.description: My circumstances have not changed since I last completed a Health Insight Survey questionnaire

blocks.page_title: About you - change of circumstances

all-in: Yes, my work or education status has changed
Yes, my work or education status has changed

question.title: What is your home address postcode?

blocks.page_title: About you - your home postcode

all-in: Yes, my work or education status has changed

question.title: What is your current work, education or other status? That is where you spend most of your time, even if you are currently absent.
description: If for example, you are working and studying, please tell us where you spend most of your time.

options.label: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work
options.value: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work

blocks.page_title: Work and Education - current status

in: Not in paid work. This includes being unemployed or retired or doing voluntary work

question.title: What best describes your current situation?

options.label: Currently working - this includes if you are on sick leave or other leave for less than 4 weeks
options.value: Currently working - this includes if you are on sick leave or other leave for less than 4 weeks

options.label: Currently not working due to sickness lasting 4 weeks or more
options.value: Currently not working due to sickness lasting 4 weeks or more

options.label: Currently not working for other reasons such as maternity or paternity lasting 4 weeks or more
options.value: Currently not working for other reasons such as maternity or paternity lasting 4 weeks or more

blocks.page_title: Work and Education - current work status

in: Currently working - this includes if you are on sick leave or other leave for less than 4 weeks

question.title: What best describes your current situation?
description: Exclude any voluntary work you may do.

options.label: Looking for paid work and able to start
options.value: Looking for paid work and able to start

options.label: Not looking for paid work due to long-term sickness or disability
options.value: Not looking for paid work due to long-term sickness or disability

options.label: Not looking for paid work for reasons such as looking after the home or family or not wanting a job
options.value: Not looking for paid work for reasons such as looking after the home or family or not wanting a job

question.title: Do you have any paid employment in addition to this, or as part of an apprenticeship?

question.title: In general, where do you currently work?
description: If currently unwell, choose where you would usually work when not unwell.

options.label: From home, meaning in the same grounds or building as your home
options.value: From home, meaning in the same grounds or building as your home

options.label: Somewhere else, meaning not at your home
options.value: Somewhere else, meaning not at your home

options.label: Both from home and somewhere else
options.value: Both from home and somewhere else

question.title: Do you have long-term physical or mental health conditions or illnesses lasting or expected to last 12 months or more?
description: Include things like diabetes, heart disease, asthma, depression, and long COVID.

GP practice - Introduction

contents.description: This section is about the services provided by your GP practice, including nurses, pharmacists, and administrative staff, such as receptionists.

question.title: In the last 28 days, have you tried to contact your GP practice for yourself or someone else in your household?
description: This could be in person, on the phone or online.

contents.description: Include contact that was made for appointments, prescriptions, and other requests.

blocks.page_title: GP practice - contact last 28 days

question.title: Thinking of the last time you tried to contact your GP practice, who was it for?

blocks.page_title: GP practice - who was contact for

question.title: Thinking of the last time you tried to contact your GP practice, did you manage to make contact with them?
description: This could be in person, on the phone or online.

options.label: Yes, two or more days later
options.value: Yes, two or more days later

options.label: No, I did not manage to make contact with my GP practice
options.value: No, I did not manage to make contact with my GP practice

blocks.page_title: GP practice - contact success

in: Yes, two or more days later

options.label: Went to a pharmacy to seek advice
options.value: Went to a pharmacy to seek advice

in: Went to a pharmacy to seek advice

description: If you tried multiple methods of contact, select the one that was successful.

options.label: Online through the GP practice website
options.value: Online through the GP practice website

options.label: Online through the NHS or other app
options.value: Online through the NHS or other app

options.label: I never knew how it would be dealt with
options.value: I never knew how it would be dealt with

question.title: Thinking of the last time you made contact with your GP practice, what did you understand the next step would be?

options.label: I was given a face-to-face appointment
options.value: I was given a face-to-face appointment

options.label: The GP or other healthcare professional called me back
options.value: The GP or other healthcare professional called me back

options.label: I received what I needed online or by telephone
options.value: I received what I needed online or by telephone
options.description: Without any call back or appointment

options.label: The GP practice asked me to do something else
options.value: The GP practice asked me to do something else
options.description: For example, call again another time, go to a pharmacy, contact 111 or seek urgent treatment

in: I was given a face-to-face appointment

The GP practice asked me to do something else

Pharmacies - Introduction

list: Pharmacy First (supply of prescription medicines to treat sore throat, urinary tract infections (women), sinusitis, earache, shingles, impetigo, infected insect bites)

contents.description: If another household member wants to start their questionnaire using the same device
You will need to click the "leave this page" link below.
They will then need to log in using their unique 16 character access code in the email or letter they were sent.

submission.title: Submit your questionnaire
submission.warning: You cannot view your answers after submission
